body.h1: How To Refer a Local-Entry in ESB Graphical Editor
body.p: A Local-Entry in WSO2 ESB Configuration can be considered as a memory registry with a Key-Value pair, where the value could be either a Text String, XML String or a URL. Local-Entries are also can be referred from mediators in ESB mediation flows and they are being resolved in the runtime. Therefore Local-entries are used to store static content so often in ESB such as XSLT files, WSDL files, URLs, etc.
In this section we are going to explain how to refer to an Local-Entry which contains a XSLT (TransformXSLT) from XSLT mediator in a mediator flow.
First you need to add the XSLT mediator to your mediation flow. Therefore you need to click on the XSLT mediator on the Tool Palette and then click on the Canvas area of the ESB Editor.
Once you add the XSLT mediator in the above manner, you will be able to see the XSLT Static Schema Key property in the Eclipse Properties view which accepts our XSLT Reference.
Then click on the button at the end of this property and it will populate the Resource Key Editor dialog as shown in the Image below.

In this dialog, click on the workspace link and it will populate the Workspace Element Provider where it list outs all the Local-Entries in workspace categorized by ESB Configuration Project as shown below.

Once you select the correct Local-Entry from the list of Local-Entries, you can click on Ok button and it will populate the correct Local-Entry name as the value for the XSLT Static Schema Key property in Eclipse Properties view as indicated in the image below.
